comment.author: 16830149@N02
comment._content:
Taken from Medal Card Index
Theatre of war first served in: 13/Egypt
Date of entry therein: 29.12.1915
Victory, British & 15 Star medals

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content: Born 1890/1 Hull East Yorks. 1891 census records him living 15 Willow Place, Cottingham, Hull with his Father Cornelius , a bricklayer, and Mother Jesse / Bessy / Betsy. 1901 census 70 Leonard Street, Sculcoates with his Father, Mother and a younger brother, Phillip. Diary of the 13th Btn East Yorkshire Reg. Link www.east-yorkshire-regiment.co.uk/db/btn/diary.php?kfb=15

comment.author: 32300107@N06
comment._content: Hi, thank you for telling us more about Private Greenwood.

comment.author: 69782596@N07
comment._content:
Family information (from Ancestry.co.uk):

1913 (Feb 14th) Married Gertrude Mary Spendlow in Sculcoates, Hull.

1913 (July 11th) Child born: Cornelius (who died 1990)

1914 (Sept 20th) Child born: Dennis (who died 1975)

comment.author: 38811045@N04
comment._content: An original member of the 4th Hull Pals Battalion.  Almost certainly joined up on the 16th December 1914.  Assuming (and this may be a wrong assumption) that men were allocated to a company on joining, his number also ties in with D Company: first 250 men to A Coy, next 250 men to B Coy etc.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: 1911 living with his family at 18 Ash Grove Hull. Cornelius jnr was described as a Builder, probably working with his father who was described as a Master Builder. His service record appears at www.ancestry.co.uk and shows at the time of enlistment he was living at 12 Lanark Street Hull, aged 24 years and 90 days and a Bricklayer. Height 5' 4". Chest 36 1/2". No distinctive marks. Next of kin: Gertrude Mary Greenwood (formerly Spendlow). Married at the Registry Office, Sculcoates, Hull Feb 14 1913. Children's names and details as shown by NPT273. Gertrude married again in 1920 in Sculcoates to a William T Crawforth.
